item.description:
As a way to explore providence, I'm going to put together a scavenger hunt to cover a bit of downtown and the east side.

Teams will be formed to scavenge the area based on clue sheets that will be distributed at the start. Since this is a newcomers events, teams will be assigned at random just before the start. The search area will kept to within a 1 square mile to reduce or eliminate the need for cars roaming the city. Teams will be of 3-4 people.

The items to be "scavenged" will be a photo of the item described in the clue. Every team will need to have at least one digital camera or cell phone with camera built in.

Thanks for your RSVP as a Yes or Maybe to the Scavenger Hunt that I'll be hosting this Sunday on the East Side of Providence. I'm having a great time putting together the hunt and look forward to seeing everyone on Sunday.

Here's how the hunt will work:

1. I've tried to keep the hunt area small enough that it can be walked. I expect that over the course of the hunt a team should cover 2-3 miles. It is up to you to drive, but I hope it isn't necessary. The hunt area encompasses about 1 square mile.

2. Parking: The meeting location is going to be near Wickenden and East Street. I recommend parking on East, Wickenden, Governor, Ives, Carpenter and George Cohan streets.

3. Starting Location:


  • I'll be there by 3:40. If you can, please arrive a little before 4pm so that teams can be assigned and the hunt can start as close to 4 as possible


4. What to Bring:

  • If you have a digital camera, please bring it, and any cables that you need to connect it to a computer. I need to be able to see the photos and verify that they are indeed of target items in the hunt. To that end, I'll have a computer with to do that. If you don't have a camera to bring, that's fine, Every team will have someone with a camera on it.
  • Good Walking Shoes.
  • Money, if you want to partake of refreshments along the way, or at our end location. Food will be available for order.
  • A sense of adventure and willingness to meet new people.


5. Basic Rules

  • Teams will be 4 to 5 people.
  • Each team will need a name.
  • Each team will need one camera.
  • All scavenged items must be photographed on a single device. (eg: teams must stay together)
  • Teams will be randomly chosen at the start area to encourage socialization.
  • Scavenger Hunt ends at 6pm. If you haven't found the Finish location by 6:15, please call me.
  • Each item on the hunt will be worth a certain number of points, the team with the most points will win the adulation and applause of the other teams, and a free round on me.
  • If you become lost or need assistance, you will be able to call me during the event.
  • There is no time bonus for finishing early, nor penalty for finishing late.
  • It may not be possible to get a photo of all items.
  • Basic maps of the area will be provided that outline the search area and street grid.
  • Scavenger lists will be distributed once teams have been formed and had a moment to introduce themselves to each other.
item.how_to_find_us: Find the bridge that no motorized vehicle can drive on.
item.name: First Ever Providence Scavenger Hunt
